comments.author: lars18th

comments.snippet:
Hi

Did you try the method described in Issue #639? If I am correct, this should open it in a tab instead of a window that got opened.

Generally I am on your side that mRemoteNG should support the WSL connection natively, but I don't get why one should use a wrapper like pterm when it could be done natively. And when we are talking about Terminals, Microsoft has a great one as well: https://apps.microsoft.com/store/detail/windows-terminal/9N0DX20HK701

Regards
